questions.q: Which European city is known as the 'City of Canals' and is built on water?
Tokyo's rapid growth after WWII transformed it into what?
opts: The world's most populous metropolitan area

questions.q: Barcelona's unique architecture is primarily associated with which architect?
New York City's nickname 'The Big Apple' ____ from a racing columnist in the 1920s.
Melbourne is consistently ranked as one of the world's most ____ cities for quality of life.
Which South American city sits at the highest altitude of any major capital?
Singapore's rapid transformation from a trading post to a financial hub is described as an ____ success story.
The Rio de Janeiro Christ the Redeemer statue was completed in which decade?
Cairo's location on the Nile River has made it strategically important for ____ millennia.
Istanbul ____ the distinction of being the only city on two continents.
Paris was originally a Roman settlement called ____.
Dubai's development from a small fishing village to a metropolis happened primarily in the ____ century.
Which city hosted the 2016 Olympics and is known for its mountainous terrain?
London's financial district is known as the ____, named after a historical area.
Toronto is Canada's largest city and is known for its cultural ____.
